item.title: Project Euler 72: Counting Fractions
Project Euler 69: Totient Maximum
item.description: Problem Statement Euler’s totient function, \(\varphi(n)\), counts the number of positive integers less than \(n\) that are coprime to \(n\). Figure 1: Note that \(\frac{n}{\varphi(n)}\) takes on a maximum at \(n = 6\) in the range of this table. Given \(N\), find the smallest value \(n<N\) such that \(\frac{n}{\varphi(n)}\) achieves a maximum. My Algorithm We use Euler’s product formula for the totient function, \begin{equation} \varphi(n) = n\prod\limits_{p|n}\left(1 - \frac{1}{p}\right), \end{equation}
